alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 6:29AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches, and 10 to 14 inches above 3000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Newport, Sherman Pass, Downtown Spokane, Orin-Rice Road, Inchelium, Spokane Valley, Flowery Trail Road, Republic, Springdale-Hunters Road, Fairfield, Chesaw Road, Wauconda, Rockford, Deer Park, Tiger, Ione, Colville, Kettle Falls, Chewelah, Metaline Falls, Cheney, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Airway Heights, Northport, Metaline, Boulder Creek Road, Davenport, and Fruitland. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may bring down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area
